snippet: Amazon wants to eliminate the distance between its customers and its products. One way to do this would be to open up its own stores. Very unlikely, analysts say. But no one expected Apple to open stores, either. And Amazon has made several moves --...
abstract: Amazon wants to eliminate the distance between its customers and its products. One way to do this would be to open up its own stores. Very unlikely, analysts say. But no one expected Apple to open stores, either. And Amazon has made several moves -- announcing five new United States warehouses, testing out delivery lockers in New York and Seattle, and continuing to experiment with a grocery delivery service -- that put it closer to its customers.
lead_paragraph: Much of the discussion about Amazon is focused on its digital side, yet the company is relentlessly expanding into the physical.

headline.main: Amazon Has Tried Everything to Make Shopping Easier. Except This.
